vfrlight.webhook_verify_util module¶

vfrlight.webhook_verify_util.domain_is_valid(domain)[source]¶

Check whether the given domain is a valid source for webhook request.

vfrlight.webhook_verify_util.get_hmac(body, secret)[source]¶

Calculate the HMAC value of the given request body and secret as per Shopify’s documentation for Webhook requests. See: http://docs.shopify.com/api/tutorials/using-webhooks#verify-webhook

vfrlight.webhook_verify_util.get_proxy_signature(query_dict, secret)[source]¶

Calculate the signature of the given query dict as per Shopify’s documentation for proxy requests. See: http://docs.shopify.com/api/tutorials/application-proxies#security

vfrlight.webhook_verify_util.get_signal_name_for_topic(webhook_topic)[source]¶

Convert a Shopify Webhook topic (eg “orders/create”) to the equivalent Pythonic method name (eg “orders_create”).

vfrlight.webhook_verify_util.hmac_is_valid(body, secret, hmac_to_verify)[source]¶

Return True if the given hmac_to_verify matches that calculated from the given body and secret.

vfrlight.webhook_verify_util.proxy_signature_is_valid(request, secret)[source]¶

Return true if the calculated signature matches that present in the query string of the given request.

vfrlight.webhook_verify_util.webhook_callback(request, value='update')[source]¶

vfrlight.wsgi module¶

WSGI config for vfrlight project.

It exposes the WSGI callable as a module-level variable named application.

For more information on this file, see https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.0/howto/deployment/wsgi/
